intro: Austrobaeckea columnaris, commonly known as the slender sandalwood, is a small evergreen tree native to southeastern Australia. It is characterized by its slender, columnar growth habit and smooth, greyish bark. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels, typically blooming in spring. Its leaves are narrow, lance-shaped, and have a leathery texture. Austrobaeckea columnaris is often found in sandy soils and is adapted to coastal or inland dry environments.
